question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: execute_block()] [State view lifetime violation] Can execute_block() implementations retain references to state_view beyond the function's lifetime, causing use-after-free vulnerabilities when state_view is dropped? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: execute_block()] [Deterministic execution failure] Can non-deterministic bugs in executor implementations (e.g., HashMap iteration order, thread scheduling) cause different validators to produce different ShardedExecutionOutput results, breaking consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: execute_block()] [Write set integrity] Can execute_block() return TransactionOutput with manipulated write sets that don't match the actual state changes applied, bypassing Merkle tree validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: execute_block()] [Event emission bypass] Can malicious executors suppress or inject events into TransactionOutput.events() that don't correspond to actual transaction execution, breaking event indexing integrity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: execute_block()] [Gas refund manipulation] Can execute_block() manipulate gas refund calculations in TransactionOutput to return more gas than actually consumed, enabling gas exploitation attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: shutdown()] [Resource leak] Can shutdown() fail to properly clean up executor shard threads, cross-shard channels, or state view resources, causing memory leaks and resource exhaustion over time? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: shutdown()] [Concurrent shutdown race] If shutdown() is called while execute_block() is running, can this cause race conditions leading to partial transaction execution and state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: shutdown()] [Channel closure safety] Does shutdown() properly handle in-flight messages in cross-shard channels, or can messages be lost causing shards to hang waiting for cross-shard state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: shutdown()] [Double shutdown vulnerability] Can calling shutdown() multiple times cause use-after-free errors or double-drop panics in implementations that don't guard against repeated calls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Function: shutdown()] [Thread join timeout] Can shutdown() block indefinitely waiting for shard threads to finish if those threads are stuck on channel operations, preventing graceful node shutdown? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Cross-shard communication] Can malicious shards send forged CrossShardMsg messages to other shards with incorrect state values, causing dependent transactions to execute with wrong state and produce incorrect results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Cross-shard replay attack] Can Byzantine shards replay old CrossShardMsg messages from previous rounds to cause shards to execute transactions with stale state values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Cross-shard message ordering] Can race conditions in cross-shard message delivery cause messages to arrive out-of-order, violating dependency ordering and causing non-deterministic execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Shard starvation attack] Can one Byzantine shard deliberately delay sending cross-shard messages, causing other shards to block indefinitely and preventing block execution from completing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Round synchronization] Can shards execute different rounds concurrently without proper synchronization, allowing transactions from round N+1 to see uncommitted state from round N? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Aggregator consistency] Does the sharded executor properly handle AggregatorV2 operations across shards, or can concurrent updates to the same aggregator from different shards cause lost updates or incorrect final values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Total supply manipulation] Can Byzantine shards manipulate TOTAL_SUPPLY_AGGR_BASE_VAL calculations in AggregatorOverriddenStateView to cause incorrect total supply values, breaking economic invariants? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [State view caching] Can inconsistent caching behavior across shards cause the same state key to return different values in different shards, breaking deterministic execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Transaction dependency graph manipulation] Can Byzantine actors craft transactions with false dependency declarations to force specific shard assignments and create cross-shard conflicts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Parallel execution determinism] Can non-deterministic scheduling in Block-STM within individual shards cause different execution orders across validators, leading to state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Module cache inconsistency] If shards maintain separate Move module caches, can cache inconsistencies cause the same Move code to execute differently across shards? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Gas metering synchronization] Can gas accounting errors occur when aggregating gas consumption from multiple shards, allowing transactions to exceed block gas limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Error propagation] If one shard encounters a VMStatus error, do all shards properly abort execution and return consistent error states, or can partial execution occur? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Write set conflict detection] Can conflicting write sets from different shards go undetected during aggregation, allowing both writes to be applied and corrupting state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/executor_client.rs] [Trait: ExecutorClient] [Storage version consistency] Can shards operate on state views with different storage versions, causing incompatible state reads and breaking Move serialization? (High)
